StringTable.Label: Race_Altarian_Name
StringTable.String: Altarian

StringTable.Label: Race_Altarian_Dec
StringTable.String: Most Altarians adopt a Mer, a philosophy they devote their life to. This makes them more ideological than other species and more approving when their [HS=HS_Ideology]Ideology[/HS] matches that of their empire or governor, and more disapproving when it is opposed to them. They can also be specialized to [HS=HS_DivineEmpath]Divine Empaths[/HS], though it is an expensive process.

StringTable.Label: Race_Arcean_Name
StringTable.String: Arcean

StringTable.Label: Race_Arcean_Dec
StringTable.String: Arcean's stoic nature makes them unlikely to be [HS=HS_Ideology]ideological[/HS]. Instead they revere the military and Arcean soldiers gain additional [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] and are never pacifists.

StringTable.Label: Race_Baratak_Name
StringTable.String: Baratak

StringTable.Label: Race_Baratak_Dec
StringTable.String: The Baratak are stout citizens who require very little to be content. But they are sensitive to [HS=HS_Pollution]Pollution[/HS] and won't be happy, or healthy, on heavily polluted worlds.

StringTable.Label: Race_Drath_Name
StringTable.String: Drath

StringTable.Label: Race_Drath_Dec
StringTable.String: The Drath are an ancient race that are fond of their legacy and their vast storehouses of credits. They receive an [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] bonus based on the Credits in their treasury.

StringTable.Label: Race_Drengin_Name
StringTable.String: Drengin

StringTable.Label: Race_Drengin_Dec
StringTable.String: Drengin have a high [HS=HS_Resistance]Resistance[/HS] and aptitude for becoming strong [HS=HS_Soldier]Soldiers[/HS]. Drengin have no [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] penalty for living on undefended worlds. They defend themselves.

StringTable.Label: Race_Festron_Name
StringTable.String: Festron

StringTable.Label: Race_Festron_Dec
StringTable.String: Festron love Jungle worlds. They also occasionally murder other species they share a world with.

StringTable.Label: Race_Human_Name
StringTable.String: Human

StringTable.Label: Race_Human_Dec
StringTable.String: Humans are known for their flexibility and productivity. They have lower [HS=HS_Expectations]Expectations[/HS] than other species.

StringTable.Label: Race_Iconian_Name
StringTable.String: Iconian

StringTable.Label: Race_Iconian_Dec
StringTable.String: Iconians are a paranoid species that are still traumatized by their near extinction by the Yor. Because of this they suffer a significant [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] penalty if they share a world with them. And even though they are as temperamental as other species, their passive nature prevents them from protesting.

StringTable.Label: Race_Iridium_Name
StringTable.String: Iridium

StringTable.Label: Race_Iridium_Dec
StringTable.String: Iridium's high Social make them excellent [HS=HS_Trader]Traders[/HS]. They receive an [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] bonus based on the Credits in your treasury.

StringTable.Label: Race_Manti_Name
StringTable.String: Manti

StringTable.Label: Race_Manti_Dec
StringTable.String: Manti love [HS=HS_Aquatic]Aquatic[/HS] worlds. They receive a large [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] bonus when they are on them and a slight penalty when they aren't.

StringTable.Label: Race_Mimot_Name
StringTable.String: Mimot

StringTable.Label: Race_Mimot_Dec
StringTable.String: An average race with an above average [HS=HS_Growth]Growth[/HS] rate. They will quickly overwhelm planets and consume all available [HS=HS_Food]Food[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Race_Navigators_Name
StringTable.String: Navigators

StringTable.Label: Race_Navigators_Dec
StringTable.String: Navigator society is built around investigating the wonders of the universe, often to the exclusion of everything else. Their high [HS=HS_Intelligence]Intelligence[/HS] makes them the best scientists in the galaxy.

StringTable.Label: Race_Onyx_Name
StringTable.String: Onyx

StringTable.Label: Race_Onyx_Dec
StringTable.String: The Onyx have no need for organic food and sustain themselves on the energy of the universe. [HS=HS_OnyxHiveGrowth]Onyx Hive Growth[/HS] rate is dependent on the amount of Promethion their civilization holds.

StringTable.Label: Race_Torian_Name
StringTable.String: Torian

StringTable.Label: Race_Torian_Dec
StringTable.String: Torian love [HS=HS_Aquatic]Aquatic[/HS] worlds. They receive a large [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] bonus when they are on them and a slight penalty when they aren't. But their subjugation by the Drengin makes them unhappy when they share worlds with Drengin citizens.

StringTable.Label: Race_Xeloxi_Name
StringTable.String: Xeloxi

StringTable.Label: Race_Xeloxi_Dec
StringTable.String: Xeloxi have few redeeming qualities, if by few you mean none. Their culture rewards strong action and concerns like ethics or compassion were lost long ago. Every Xeloxi is a criminal and generates [HS=HS_Crime]Crime[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Race_Yor_Name
StringTable.String: Yor

StringTable.Label: Race_Yor_Dec
StringTable.String: As a synthetic species Yor don't require [HS=HS_Food]Food[/HS] or have any natural [HS=HS_Growth]Growth[/HS]. Instead their citizens are manufactured.[BR][BR]They also don't suffer any [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] penalty from Pollution, Overcrowding or reaching their Population Capacity.

StringTable.Label: Race_Burran_Name
StringTable.String: Burran

StringTable.Label: Race_Burran_Dec
StringTable.String: A peaceful species who believes that a series of 7 "rigors" will cause them to be elevated to a godlike existence. Each rigor takes many years to accomplish and only the first 3 of these can be performed on their home planet, afterwards they explore the universe pursuing their tasks.

StringTable.Label: Race_Orphica_Name
StringTable.String: Orphica Enclave

StringTable.Label: Race_Orphica_Dec
StringTable.String: The Orphic Enclave serves only to expand the power of an ancient, renegade supercomputer.

StringTable.Label: Race_Klepart_Name
StringTable.String: Klepart

StringTable.Label: Race_Klepart_Dec
StringTable.String: The first united technical achievement of their species was the creation of a great beacon tower to send their call out into space. A few days after turning it on an answer was received, a fleet of warships appeared in orbit above their world and raiders were sent down to collect every child on their homeworld. And then the raiders were gone. An entire generation of the Klepart was lost. The next generation has now grown old enough to begin exploring space on their own, but they remain fearful that the raiders will return, and hopeful that they will someday find the children that were stolen from them.

StringTable.Label: Race_Kaxx_Name
StringTable.String: Kaxx Collective

StringTable.Label: Race_Kaxx_Dec
StringTable.String: They believe their home world is the cocoon for a sleeping creature and they were placed on the planet to guard her. One day they believe the creature will awake and either spread new life across the universe or kill everyone.

StringTable.Label: Race_Odair_Name
StringTable.String: Odair Conclave

StringTable.Label: Race_Odair_Dec
StringTable.String: Extreme nihilists counting down the moments until the universe succumbs to the eventual pull of entropy. Believe the Krynn in particular are the most foolish (for their faith) but are hard pressed to be enthused about anyone. There is a black hole at the edge of their galaxy, "The Yawning Mouth of God" that they delight in sending elaborate constructions into.

StringTable.Label: Race_Lantern_Name
StringTable.String: Lantern

StringTable.Label: Race_Lantern_Dec
StringTable.String: A young but promising race until early galactic traders introduced them to euphoric vapors that were enjoyed by other species but deeply addictive to the Lantern. Now the Lantern society is dominated by the search for additional sources of the drug and all citizens are kept on it at all times.

StringTable.Label: Race_Snathi_Name
StringTable.String: Snathi

StringTable.Label: Race_Snathi_Dec
StringTable.String: Snathi are clever and resourceful, but very likely to be criminals.

StringTable.Label: Race_Trandal_Name
StringTable.String: Trandal

StringTable.Label: Race_Trandal_Dec
StringTable.String: Easily distracted and always hungry Trandals are good at taking orders, and that's about it.

StringTable.Label: Race_Tywom_Name
StringTable.String: Tywom

StringTable.Label: Race_Tywom_Dec
StringTable.String: The Tywom aren't very smart, and certainly aren't very socially adept. Their only positive quality is their incredibly low [HS=HS_Expectations]Expectations[/HS]. They are very accustomed to being treated poorly, and they are even happier when they share a world with other species. Though the other species may not like it.

StringTable.Label: Race_Korath_Name
StringTable.String: Korath

StringTable.Label: Race_Korath_Dec
StringTable.String: If you thought the Drengin were disagreeable, the Korath are even worse. Though they have incredible [HS=HS_Resolve]Resolve[/HS] and [HS=HS_Diligence]Diligence[/HS] their social skills are lacking and they dislike sharing a world with any other species.

StringTable.Label: Race_Slyne_Name
StringTable.String: Slyne

StringTable.Label: Race_Slyne_Dec
StringTable.String: The Slyne do not require organic food to survive, but their slow [HS=HS_Growth]Growth[/HS] rate hampers their ability to spread out into the galaxy as quickly as other species.

StringTable.Label: Race_Thalan_Name
StringTable.String: Thalan

StringTable.Label: Race_Thalan_Dec
StringTable.String: The Thalan are from a dimension more advanced than ours. Their insight provides them with an increased [HS=HS_Intelligence]Intelligence[/HS] and also increased [HS=HS_Expectations]Expectations[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Race_Phamysht_Name
StringTable.String: Phamysht

StringTable.Label: Race_Phamysht_Dec
StringTable.String: The Phamysht are a polite and engaging species, until they murder you. Still, their high [HS=HS_Social]Social[/HS] and [HS=HS_Intelligence]Intelligence[/HS] makes up for their equally high [HS=HS_Expectations]Expectations[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Race_Scryve_Name
StringTable.String: Scryve

StringTable.Label: Race_Scryve_Dec
StringTable.String: The Scryve are waning. Each of their citizens has incredibly high [HS=HS_Diligence]Diligence[/HS], [HS=HS_Intelligence]Intelligence[/HS] and [HS=HS_Resolve]Resolve[/HS] but they are handicapped by their low [HS=HS_Growth]Growth[/HS] which will make it difficult to spread out among the stars unless they capture another species to do it.

StringTable.Label: Race_Crystalline_Name
StringTable.String: Luxar

StringTable.Label: Race_Crystalline_Dec
StringTable.String: Luxar have no need for organic food but their [HS=HS_OnyxHiveGrowth]Growth[/HS] is generally less than organic species. Their growth can be increased based on the amount of Promethion they have stored.[BR][BR]Despite their low growth rate their high [HS=HS_Diligence]Diligence[/HS], [HS=HS_Intelligence]Intelligence[/HS] and [HS=HS_Resolve]Resolve[/HS] makes them well suited for nearly any task.

StringTable.Label: Race_Absolute_Name
StringTable.String: Irradiated Amoeba

StringTable.Label: Race_Absolute_Dec
StringTable.String: Irradiated citizens evolve if given enough time, each evolution more capable than the last. At the starting Amoeba stage, they reproduce frequently and are quick to evolve but are poor workers.

StringTable.Label: Race_Absolute2_Name
StringTable.String: Irradiated Larva

StringTable.Label: Race_Absolute2_Dec
StringTable.String: Irradiated citizens evolve if given enough time, each evolution more capable than the last. At the Larva stage, their [HS=HS_Growth]Growth Rate[/HS] slows, but they are more skilled than their Amoeba forms.

StringTable.Label: Race_Absolute3_Name
StringTable.String: Irradiated Nymph

StringTable.Label: Race_Absolute3_Dec
StringTable.String: Irradiated citizens evolve if given enough time, each evolution more capable than the last. At the final Nymph stage, their [HS=HS_Growth]Growth Rate[/HS] slows significantly, but they are highly skilled.

StringTable.Label: Race_Seeing_Name
StringTable.String: Intueri

StringTable.Label: Race_Seeing_Dec
StringTable.String: The Intueri have high [HS=HS_Diligence]Diligence[/HS] and low [HS=HS_Expectations]Expectations[/HS]. They put the needs of the group over their own. Lacking true complex thought -expect low [HS=HS_Intelligence]Intelligence[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Race_Moth_Name
StringTable.String: Phalenoids

StringTable.Label: Race_Moth_Dec
StringTable.String: Brilliant and sociable creatures, Phalenoids excel in [HS=HS_Intelligence]Intelligence[/HS] and [HS=HS_Social]Social[/HS], but they make poor soldiers. They prefer to befriend other species. Their [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] increases when sharing their world with other species.

StringTable.Label: Race_Feline_Name
StringTable.String: Feline

StringTable.Label: Race_Feline_Dec
StringTable.String: Elegant and astute, Felinoids distinguish themselves with keen intellect and agile cunning. They prefer roles of strategic importance, thriving as scientists, diplomats, or spies, and display an affinity for complex systems. Highly individualistic, they can struggle with regimented military roles. Their curious natures make them adept cultural adapters, gaining an [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] bonus when cohabiting worlds with other species.

StringTable.Label: Race_Canine_Name
StringTable.String: Canine

StringTable.Label: Race_Canine_Dec
StringTable.String: Loyal and intuitive, Caninoids demonstrate exceptional teamwork and remarkable instincts. They naturally excel in roles requiring cooperation and protection, such as military or policing duties. While not typically drawn to independent intellectual pursuits, they're formidable tactical operators within a group dynamic. Their sociable temperament engenders strong bonds, earning them an [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] boost when sharing their world with other species. They have very low expectations.

StringTable.Label: Race_Avian_Name
StringTable.String: Avian

StringTable.Label: Race_Avian_Dec
StringTable.String: Graceful and visionary, Avianoids are known for their strategic foresight and aerial mastery. They excel in roles requiring a broad perspective, such as scouts, diplomats, or strategic planners. Their nimble agility can be less effective in ground-based military engagements. With a natural inclination towards harmony, they gain an [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] bonus when coexisting with diverse species on their world.

StringTable.Label: Race_Minor_Name
StringTable.String: Minor Race

StringTable.Label: Race_Minor_Dec
StringTable.String: A less advanced species that is unable to travel outside their solar system.

StringTable.Label: Race_Zombie_Name
StringTable.String: Zombies

StringTable.Label: Race_Zombie_Dec
StringTable.String: Horrible ghouls that grow quickly but aren't very bright.

StringTable.Label: Race_RuinedTorian_Name
StringTable.String: Ruined Torian

StringTable.Label: Race_RuinedTorian_Dec
StringTable.String: These pitiful creatures have had their will tortured out of them.
